transcript.title: PM 10/1966 - Resignation of Senator Sir Shane Paltridge
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P. M. No. 10/ 1966

With the consent of His Excellency the Governor-General, I announce that Senator Sir Shane Paltridge, Minister for Defence, has tendered his resignation as Minister and as Leader of the Government in the Senate.
As is well-known, Sir Shane has been very seriously ill for some time. His medical advisers concur in the decision which he has now made. 

Shane Paltridge has been for ten years a really magnificent Minister notably in Shipping and Transport, Civil Aviation, and befence. He has been a tireless worker, with a great grasp of principle as well as a mastery of
detail. His colleagues have extended to him their good wishes, and their appreciation of his high character, integrity, and ability. His services will be greatly missed.

CANBERRA,
19 January, 1966
